name: Washington State University Veterinary Teaching Hospital
notes: Located in Pullman. The primary facility for comprehensive wildlife care in the region. Handles all species. Advise callers to phone ahead.

name: WDFW Eastern Region (Region 1) Office
notes: For non-emergency wildlife issues (e.g., nuisance animals, questions). For emergencies after hours, direct callers to WDFW Enforcement dispatch or 911.

name: WDFW North Central Region (Region 2) Office
notes: For non-emergency wildlife issues (e.g., nuisance animals, questions). For emergencies after hours, direct callers to WDFW Enforcement dispatch or 911.

name: WDFW Enforcement Dispatch
notes: For reporting poaching, dangerous wildlife encounters, or when a wildlife officer is needed after hours. For immediate public safety threats, call 911 first.

name: Central Washington Wildlife Hospital
hours: Varies, call for information and to arrange drop-off.
notes: Located near Ellensburg. Does not handle large mammals like deer, bears, or cougars. Call before bringing an animal.

name: Blue Mountain Wildlife
notes: Located in Pendleton, OR, but serves SE Washington. Specializes in birds of prey and other avian species. Excellent resource for injured raptors.

name: Spokane County Regional Animal Protection Service (SCRAPS)
hours: Field operations 24/7 for emergencies. Shelter hours vary.
notes: Primarily for domestic animals (dogs, cats). Not equipped for wildlife, but their officers respond to public safety issues involving animals.

name: Wenatchee Valley Humane Society
notes: Contracts for animal control in several local cities. Can assist with or direct calls for certain small mammals or birds. Call for capabilities.

name: Okanogan County Sheriff's Office - Animal Control
notes: Handles domestic animal and livestock issues (e.g., dogs at large, neglect). For wildlife issues, contact WDFW.

name: Grant County Animal Control (Sheriff's Office)
notes: Handles domestic animal and livestock issues. For wildlife, contact WDFW.

name: Adams County Sheriff's Office
notes: Primary contact for domestic animal and livestock issues. For wildlife, contact WDFW.

name: Whitman County Sheriff's Office
notes: Primary contact for domestic animal and livestock issues. For wildlife, contact WDFW or WSU.

name: Pontarosa Veterinary Clinic
hours: Mon-Fri, 8 AM - 5:30 PM; Sat, 8 AM - 12 PM
notes: Located in Colville. Can stabilize injured wildlife before transfer to a licensed rehabilitator. Call ahead.

name: Ferry County Sheriff's Office
notes: Primary contact for domestic animal and livestock issues. For wildlife, contact WDFW.

name: Pend Oreille County Sheriff's Office - Animal Control
hours: Mon-Fri, 8 AM - 4 PM. After hours via dispatch.
notes: Handles domestic animal and livestock issues. For wildlife, contact WDFW.

name: Lincoln County Sheriff's Office
notes: Primary contact for domestic animal and livestock issues. For wildlife, contact WDFW.

name: Garfield County Sheriff's Office
notes: Primary contact for domestic animal and livestock issues. For wildlife, contact WDFW.

name: Columbia County Sheriff's Office
notes: Primary contact for domestic animal and livestock issues. For wildlife, contact WDFW.

name: Walla Walla County Sheriff's Office
notes: Primary contact for domestic animal and livestock issues. For wildlife, contact WDFW.

name: Asotin County Animal Shelter
notes: Located in Clarkston. Focuses on domestic pets. For animal control, call Sheriff's office.

name: Washington State Patrol
notes: Use for immediate public safety threats only, such as large animals on major highways (e.g., deer, elk, cattle on interstate).

name: Pet Emergency Clinic & Referral Center (Spokane)
notes: Primarily for domestic pets. May stabilize critical wildlife on a case-by-case basis before transfer to a licensed rehabber. Call first.

name: Animal Hospital of Omak
notes: Provides 24/7 emergency vet care for domestic and large animals in the Omak area.

name: Washington State Department of Health Rabies Info
notes: For questions about potential rabies exposure from an animal bite (e.g., bat, raccoon, coyote). This is an informational hotline, not a rescue service.

name: Inland Northwest Wildlife Council
notes: Not a direct rehab or rescue organization, but a knowledgeable source for information and referrals in the Spokane area.

name: Chewelah Veterinary Clinic
notes: General veterinary services. May provide stabilization for wildlife during business hours. Call first.

name: Davenport Veterinary Clinic
notes: General veterinary services. May provide stabilization for wildlife during business hours. Call first.

name: Alpine Veterinary Clinic
notes: Located in Cheney. General veterinary services.

name: Cascade Veterinary Clinic
notes: General veterinary practice in Wenatchee.

name: Asotin County Animal Control (Sheriff's Office)
notes: Handles domestic animal and livestock issues. For wildlife, contact WDFW.
